title: Earth observation camera maker raises $15 million for European expansion
summary: Simera Sense, a Belgian camera maker for Earth observation satellites, has raised nearly $15 million to expand its production capacity in Europe. The funding round was led by NewSpace Capital and backed by Knife Capital. The company aims to increase production from 25 to 150-200 payloads per year and develop higher-resolution camera products.
why_it_matters: The funding will enable Simera Sense to scale production and develop advanced Earth observation technologies, supporting growing demand from satellite manufacturers and institutions like the European Space Agency.
